title: 5 AI tools for video editing
description:
Discover five powerful AI tools for video editing that enhance your editing process and boost creativity.

Artificial intelligence (AI) has revolutionized the field of video editing, providing advanced tools and capabilities that enhance the editing process and open up new creative possibilities. Here are five remarkable AI tools for video editing that can transform your editing workflow and elevate your final product.

Adobe Premiere Pro

Filmmakers and video editors use Adobe Premiere Pro, a reputable video editing software. It has many options and features for non-linear editing, timeline-based editing, color correction, audio editing, effects and other things.

Premiere Pro enables smooth cooperation and flexibility in the production of high-quality videos because of its user-friendly interface and connection with other Adobe Creative Cloud applications.

Premiere Pro gives video editors the tools they need to realize their creative vision, from straightforward cutting and transitions to sophisticated color grading and audio mixing. Although it might take some time to get used to, the software is accessible to both novice and seasoned users because of its vast documentation and resources.

Adobe Premiere Pro offers a seven-day free trial for individuals, allowing users to explore its capabilities without commitment. After the trial period, the subscription for individuals is priced at 19.97 British pounds per month.

For teams, there is a 14-day free trial available for Creative Cloud All Apps. Additionally, Creative Cloud All Apps offers a seven-day free trial before requiring a discounted monthly subscription of 16.24 pounds for students and teachers. These pricing options provide flexibility for individuals, teams and educational users to access and utilize the powerful features of Adobe Premiere Pro.

Final Cut Pro X

Apple created the professional video editing software Final Cut Pro X for Mac users. It has a simple user interface and strong tools for non-destructive editing, multicam editing and adding sophisticated video and audio effects. While maintaining the integrity of the original media files, its magnetic timeline guarantees simple clip organization.

Final Cut Pro X is available from Apple for a free 90-day trial that enables customers to explore the features and functionalities of the program. Visit the official Apple website for specific information regarding minimum system requirements and other specifications. You may discover detailed information about the hardware and software needs for running Final Cut Pro X efficiently on your Mac system.

Related: 5 AI tools for learning and research

DaVinci Resolve

Blackmagic Design’s DaVinci Resolve is a thorough and top-of-the-line video editing and color grading program. Professionals in the filmmaking and post-production fields value it because of its potent features and adaptability. Users may easily work with numerous video and audio tracks, apply transitions and effects, and edit their footage in a non-destructive way using its user-friendly, non-linear editing interface.

With its precise control over color correction, grading and the creation of visually striking cinematic aesthetics, DaVinci Resolve is especially well-known for its sophisticated color grading capabilities. Professionals seeking to produce high-quality video editing and color grading outcomes frequently use it because of its comprehensive toolkit and collaborative workflow choices.

DaVinci Resolve offers a free version with some limitations, while the paid version, DaVinci Resolve Studio, is available for a flat fee of $295 and includes lifetime updates.

The free version has restrictions on exporting, limited to 4K Ultra HD and 60 fps. In contrast, DaVinci Resolve Studio allows for exporting up to 32K at 120 fps, along with advanced HDR delivery capabilities. If you require higher resolutions, such as DCI 4K at 4,096 x 2,160 or beyond, the paid version is necessary.

HitFilm Express

For innovative filmmakers and video fans, HitFilm Express offers a wealth of tools and features. It is a free video editing and visual effects program. It provides a full range of editing and compositing tools, enabling users to produce videos with outstanding visual effects that look professional.

A wide range of users can utilize HitFilm Express because it is compatible with both Mac and Windows operating systems. Users can quickly add cinematic flair to their films thanks to the application’s user-friendly interface and large library of effects, transitions and presets.

Although the commercial edition, HitFilm Pro, offers even more sophisticated functionalities for seasoned filmmakers and visual effects artists, the free version still delivers an astounding array of features.

HitFilm Express offers two subscription options for different types of users. The Creator version, designed for social media and content creators, is available at 7.99 pounds per month when billed annually or 12.99 pounds per month when billed monthly.

On the other hand, the Pro version, targeting video creators, is priced at 12.99 pounds per month billed annually or 19.99 pounds per month billed monthly. The Pro version offers additional advanced functionalities and features to meet the requirements of professional video creators.

Related: 5 YouTube channels for learning graphic design

iMovie

iMovie is a user-friendly video editing software developed by Apple Inc. It is specifically designed for Mac and iOS users, providing a straightforward and intuitive platform for creating and editing videos.

iMovie’s user-friendly interface makes video editing accessible to amateurs and casual users. Basic video editing features like trimming, splitting and combining are available in the software.

To improve their films, users can also add transitions, titles and effects. iMovie is a well-liked option for creating personal projects, home videos and content for social media since it excels at quick and straightforward video-editing jobs.

iMovie is available for free to all Mac and iOS users. It comes pre-installed on macOS and can be downloaded for free from the Mac App Store for iOS devices. There is no additional cost to use iMovie as it is included with the operating systems for Apple devices.

title: China allegedly offers bitcoin bounty to murder Australian CCP critic
description: According to an 60 Minutes Australia report, a so-called "bounty email" surfaced that purportedly offers $50,000 bounty in bitcoin (BTC) for the "termination" of Vanessa Pavlou.

title: ADA’s Price Development May Depend on the SEC Vs. Ripple Outcome
description:
According to Dan Gambardello, founder of Crypto Capital Ventures, Cadarno’s (ADA) price development could depend on the outcome of the Securities and Exchange Commission’s (SEC) case against Ripple. Gambardello explained his position by comparing ADA’s behavior since the allegation with how XRP responded under similar circumstances. In a video uploaded on YouTube, Gambardello observed that […]
